channel.title: Linux VPS
channel.description:
I've purchased a Linux VPS for my server
While I've been trying to open port '43594' I came across an error while restarting my 'iptables' on my Linux OS.
Here's a screenshot of the error: [IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/11c9iiv.png[/img]
Here is line 21: [code]-A RH-Firewall-1-INPUT -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -j ACCEPT[/code] I did not add that line it was already there.
Here it what I added to try and open port '43594' [code]-A RH-Firewall-1-INPUT -p tcp -m tcp --dport 43594 -j ACCEPT -A RH-Firewall-1-INPUT -p udp -m tcp --dport 43594 -j ACCEPT[/code] And the port is still not open, when I go to post my server on a status page it says it's offline.
Help would be GREATLY appreciated.

item.title: Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @DuhPk DuhPk
item.description:
@DuhPk wrote:

blakeman8192:

please paste the contents of /var/log/syslog

Thx for the help but I figured it out

Read full topic

item.title: Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @DuhPk DuhPk
item.description:
@DuhPk wrote:

I’ve purchased a Linux VPS for my server

While I’ve been trying to open port ‘43594’ I came across an error while restarting my ‘iptables’ on my Linux OS.

Here’s a screenshot of the error:

Here is line 21:

-A RH-Firewall-1-INPUT -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -j ACCEPT

I did not add that line it was already there.

Here it what I added to try and open port ‘43594’

-A RH-Firewall-1-INPUT -p tcp -m tcp --dport 43594 -j ACCEPT -A RH-Firewall-1-INPUT -p udp -m tcp --dport 43594 -j ACCEPT
And the port is still not open, when I go to post my server on a status page it says it’s offline.

Help would be GREATLY appreciated.

Read full topic
